AI Description: RAxML (Randomized Axelerated Maximum Likelihood) is a software for phylogenetic analysis and inference of evolutionary trees. It is widely used for maximum likelihood-based phylogenetic tree estimation.
Core Features:
1. Fast and efficient computation of maximum likelihood phylogenetic trees
2. Uses a rapid bootstrap algorithm for rapid analysis of large datasets
3. Supports a wide range of substitution models and phylogenetic models
4. Can handle both nucleotide and amino acid sequence data
5. Provides options for branch length optimization, among other tree features
